docs.snippet: New strides in how to make doing the right thing easy were one recurring theme of the Fixes column during the year just ending.

headline.print_headline: A Year of Big Ideas in Social Change
headline.main: A Year of Big Ideas in Social Change

docs.snippet: Officer Jeronimo Yanez shot Mr. Castile after pulling him over in Falcon Heights, Minn. The aftermath was streamed on Facebook Live by Mr. Castile’s girlfriend.

headline.print_headline: Officer Who Shot Black Driver Is Charged With Manslaughter
headline.main: Officer Who Shot Philando Castile Is Charged With Manslaughter

docs.abstract: Prosecutors in Ramsey County, Minn, charge Police Officer Jeronimo Yanez with second-degree manslaughter and two felony counts of intentional discharge of dangerous weapon; Yanez killed Philando Castile during July traffic stop in Falcon Heights; police shooting of black victim sparked public outcry.

docs.snippet: A Pennsylvania woman found dead alongside her husband and three children in an apparent murder-suicide had told friends on social media that she planned to leave him.

headline.print_headline: Woman Had Planned to Leave Husband on Day Family Found Dead
headline.main: Woman Had Planned to Leave Husband on Day Family Found Dead

docs.snippet: A U.S. Federal Reserve official's offhand remark questioning the motives of a group of protesters managed to inflame tensions at an otherwise tranquil central banking conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Fed's Bullard Sets Off Spat With Quip Over Activists' Funding
headline.main: Fed's Bullard Sets Off Spat With Quip Over Activists' Funding

docs.snippet: A man charged in the kidnapping of a woman found alive confessed to the unsolved killings of four people in 2003, and may be linked to a total of seven deaths, the authorities said.

headline.print_headline: South Carolina Man Linked to Multiple Killings
headline.main: South Carolina Man May Be Linked to 7 Killings, Authorities Say

docs.abstract: South Carolina man Todd C Kohlhepp, who was charged with kidnapping after Kala V Bow was found in storage locker on his property, confesses to unsolved 2003 quadruple homicide; body of Bow's boyfriend Charles D Carver is found buried on property.

docs.snippet: Al Gore was to meet with Ivanka Trump on climate change, but the former vice president got to bend the ear of the president-elect himself.

headline.main: Trump Meets With Al Gore on Climate Change While House G.O.P. Rebuffs Tariff Plan

docs.snippet: Our top 10 comments of the week: Readers discuss “burkini” bans, the devastation from the Italian earthquake, the EpiPen price surge and more.

headline.main: ‘Isn’t It Also Against Her Freedom of Choice?’

docs.snippet: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. Today, great reads from Stacy Cowley, Quentin Hardy and others.
docs.abstract: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. Today, great reads from Stacy Cowley, Quentin Hardy and others.

docs.snippet: A peace activist in Charlotte, North Carolina, has been offering police and protesters free hugs in an attempt to calm three nights of unrest that have engulfed the city in the wake of the fatal shooting of a black man by police.

headline.print_headline: Peace Activist Tries to Calm Charlotte Protests With Free Hugs
headline.main: Peace Activist Tries to Calm Charlotte Protests With Free Hugs

docs.snippet: Shreveport police are investigating posts to a large neighborhood watch group suggesting recent car break-ins are reason to watch young, black men or teens, and even for so-called "vigilante justice."

headline.print_headline: Police: Neighborhood Watch Posts Call to Watch Young Blacks
headline.main: Police: Neighborhood Watch Posts Call to Watch Young Blacks
